result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John C. Cobb

records.addlTxt: 3:01 PM Defendant John C. Cobb not in court.  Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt in court for John C. Cobb.  Attorney Christian J Ness in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and appearances. No appearance by defendant. Atty Thomas-Schmidt makes statement on the defendant's non-appearance. State requests warrant. Court will authorize warrant-stayed until 11/7 @ 4:30.

2:59 PM Defendant John C. Cobb appeared by video.  Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt in court for John C. Cobb.  Attorney Christian J Ness in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and appearances. Status from Atty Thomas-Schmidt-requesting one additional status. No objections-bond to continue.
Status conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on October 31, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

10:09 AM Defendant John C. Cobb in court.  Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt in court for John C. Cobb.  Attorney Christian J Ness in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and appearances. Waived reading. Not guilty plea is entered. Set for status-bond to continue.
Status conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on September 12, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
No contact w/ R.D. or his address at 214 Walnut Street
Absolute sobriety. 
Court authorizes on trip to the residence with Law Enforcement to retrieve belongings. Defendant is to also return house key.

1:00 PM Defendant John C Cobb appeared by video, in custody. Court calls case and appearances. Aaron Marcoux appears for the State of Wisconsin. Stephanie Thomas-Schmidt appears for the State Public Defenders Office. Court reviews probable cause. Court finds probable cause. Court questions the defendant.
Current Address:
214 Walnut St
Spooner, WI 54801
#912-331-8646
Defendant does not qualify for a Public Defender. State makes sentencing argument-requesting signature bond w/ no contact. Argument from Atty Thomas-Schmidt. Court sets bond.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.
